thread.title: Glendale offense surges in playoff win at Central
thread.title_full: Glendale offense surges in playoff win at Central

title: Glendale offense surges in playoff win at Central
text:
Glendale offense surges in playoff win at Central Rance Burger , News-Leader 11:02 p.m. CDT October 23, 2015 Buy Photo Central High School lineman Arthel Harris (92) walks toward the sideline after the team took the field prior to the start of the Bulldogs' game against Glendale High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School wide receiver Trevor Weidmann (8) is tackled by Bulldogs defensive back Tyrone Walker (20) during first quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School senior cheerleader Kiersten Meyer checks her hair on her car window's reflection prior to the start of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Central High School wide receiver Tyrone Walker (20) warms up prior to the start of the Bulldogs' game against Glendale High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo The Central high School Kilties perform prior to the start of the Bulldogs' game against Glendale High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School defensive back Carson Liston (45) intercepts a pass intended for Bulldogs wide receiver Ian Holyfield (5) during first quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School wide receiver Zah Helm (25) catches a touchdown pass during first quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School quarterback Alex Houston (7) hurdles his way towards the end zone for a touchdown in second quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School linebacker Ian Marshall (9) celebrates after sacking Bulldogs quarterback Quintin Batson (not pictured) in second quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Central High School wide receiver D'Anthony Sappington walks in the Bulldog sideline during second quarter action of Central's game against Glendale High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School wide receiver Reuben Lopez (82) trots into the end zone for a touchdown in third quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Fullscreen Buy Photo Glendale High School wide receiver Jeremy Almeida (88) drags Bulldogs defenders Ian Holyfield (5) and D'Anthony Sappington (1) in second quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide Buy Photo Glendale High School wide receiver Reuben Lopez (82) trots into the end zone for a touchdown in third quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. (Photo: Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader) Buy Photo 2 CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Records fell, touchdowns piled up and Glendale’s first family of football celebrated a playoff win. 
Mike Mauk held one of his grandchildren close on the sideline shortly after Glendale defeated Central 76-48 at Harrison Stadium in the opening round of the Class 5 District 5 playoffs. Embattled Missouri Tigers quarterback Maty Mauk was in the stands to watch his father Mike and brother, offensive coordinator Ben Mauk, coach Glendale to its first playoff win in their two seasons with the Falcons. 
“I think our guys have come a long way. We’re nowhere near we want to be, but they’ve been resilient,” Mike Mauk said. “They work hard, they’ve committed themselves to trying to be the very best they can.” 
Glendale sophomore quarterback Alex Huston went 33-of-41 passing for 470 yards and nine passing touchdowns, an apparent state record. His season total of 5,108 passing yards also appears to break a record set in 2005. Buy Photo 
Central High School wide receiver D'Anthony Sappington walks in the Bulldog sideline during second quarter action of Central's game against Glendale High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. (Photo: Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader) 
Junior wide receiver Luke Montgomery had 11 receptions for 145 yards and three touchdowns. With 26 touchdown receptions on the season, Montgomery ties the Missouri record and surpasses the Springfield Public Schools record of 24 touchdowns in a season held by Hillcrest graduate Dorial Green-Beckham, now of the NFL’s Tennessee Titans. 
Mauk sent his players directly to two waiting buses after the game and did not make them available for postgame interviews. Mauk said that the team’s success matters more than chasing individual milestones. 
“I don’t think it’s something that they shoot for,” Mauk said. “The most important thing is to try to help us win.” Buy Photo 
Glendale High School linebacker Ian Marshall (9) celebrates after sacking Bulldogs quarterback Quintin Batson (not pictured) in second quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. (Photo: Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader) 
Glendale (4-6) scored on 11 consecutive possessions. Central (5-5) struggled to stop the 5-wide receiver, hurry-up style the Falcons use. Bulldogs coach Lorenzo Williams complimented Glendale for its stellar attack. 
“What they do is really unique, we’re not used to seeing it. (Glendale) did a good job of making plays when they had to make plays,” Williams said. “I’ve got to give a hats off to Mike and Ben, they do a great job over there. I feel like I just got beat by a hall of fame coach.” 
Central sophomore Garrett King carried the ball 25 times for 135 yards and three touchdowns in the loss. Seth Holyfield scored a touchdown on a two-yard run in the fourth quarter of what would be his final high school football game. 
While there were tears in the Central locker room and the departure of four seniors to observe, Williams encouraged his team to be positive. Central had not enjoyed a winning season since 2002. Buy Photo 
Glendale High School quarterback Alex Houston (7) hurdles his way towards the end zone for a touchdown in second quarter action of the Falcons' game against Central High School at Harrison Stadium in Springfield, Mo. on Oct. 23, 2015. (Photo: Guillermo Hernandez Martinez/News-Leader) 
“We haven’t been .500 here in forever, we haven’t had a winning regular season in forever,” Williams said. “I’m telling my guys, ‘I know you all are upset we lost this game, but understand what we are doing here is still special, men. Don’t hang our heads down about one loss,’ because it’s bigger than that.” 
Glendale advances to the district semifinals and will play on the road Oct. 30 at 7 p.m. at Republic (5-4), the recipients of the No. 1 seed and a first round bye in the seven-team district. 2 CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://sgfnow.co/1S1QV3A TOP VIDEOS
